I do it twice in a week.

It's similar with 'I did play piano yesterday' vs 'I played piano yesterday' : although they share the same literal meaning, both of them have a different highlight.

quote.msg:

replies.msg:
I would say the sentence structure is grammatically correct, although it seems not to be acceptable in Hong Kong.

'I do it only twice a week' is a more 'appropriate' expression in multilingual Hong Kong.

As far as I know 'twice only in a week' is a generally recognised expression around English speakers in Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland.

I wouldn't write this phrase in my writing exams in HK tho. After all it seems to be a deviation from the English 'standard' we are taught in HK. Just a curious question that came across my mind today.
